cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential at time of advisory)
cyclone.current_location: about 330 miles ESE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving generally north-northwest then north, forecast to cross eastern North Carolina on Saturday, arc across southeastern Virginia and the Delmarva Peninsula Sunday, and lift toward New Jersey / southern New England late Sunday–Monday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern North Carolina coast (near Cape Lookout-Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch area extends Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE; storm-surge watch Surf City NC to Duck NC, parts of Chesapeake Bay and tidal Potomac.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE; storm-surge warning Duck NC to Chincoteague VA and adjacent tidal rivers.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from South Carolina through North Carolina, Virginia, Maryland, Delaware and as far north as the New Jersey shore and southern New England.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible upper limit but more likely 2–4 inches (near-threshold)
weather_observation.wind: Low-end tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft possible along the New Jersey coast including New York Harbor at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain forecast late Saturday night through Sunday with isolated flooding of poor-drainage and urban areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf through the weekend; isolated coastal flooding during high-tide cycles.
